recipe_name: Rich and Thick Ice Cream Shake

steps: Place ice cream, chocolate syrup, vanilla, and milk in a blender. Blend until creamy, about 30 seconds.
Pour into a tall, chilled glass. Add whipped cream and toppings, if desired.
In a small saucepan over medium heat, bring sugar and warm water to a low boil. Set aside and let cool.
Pour sugar syrup into a large pitcher. Add cold water and lemon juice and mix.
Place ice into a tall glass and pour lemonade over. Garnish with lemon slices.
Fill in bottom half of a double boiler with warm water. Bring to a low boil. In the top part of the double boiler, combine chocolate and ½ c. water, stirring occasionally, until melted and smooth.

Remove the top boiler pan and whisk in 6 tablesppons hot water. Pour the liquid into a pitcher or divide among 8 mugs. Stir ¾ c. hot milk into each mug. Add cinnamon, sugar, and whipped cream to taste.
In a large saucepan or slow cooker, heat apple cider, orange juice, oranges, cinnamon, and nutmeg until very warm but not boiling.
Serve in mugs with cinnamon stick pieces.
Blend apple pieces and juice in a blender until smooth. Add ice to fill the blender to the top. Blend well.
Serve in a tall glass.
A day prior, peel potatoes and then use a spiral cutter to create potato spirals. Place spirals into a large bowl of ice water. Cover and refrigerate for 8 hours.
Pour about 2" of peanut oil into a large stockpot. Heat oil to 400°F.
Drain potato spirals and lay them out on baking sheets lined with paper towels to dry. Fry in batches, keeping the oil at 400°. Turn the potatoes in the oil until light brown, about 4 minutes total.
Drain on fresh paper towels. Sprinkle with sea salt, paprika, and garlic salt while still warm.
Preheat oven to 475°

Using a mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, blend flour, salt, sugar, and dry yeast. Mixing on low, add the warm water in a steady stream. Continue to mix and increase the speed as needed to mix and knead the dough. Knead for 5 minutes, until the sides of the bowl are clean.
Place dough in an oiled bowl and cover the top of the bowl with plastic wrap. Let sit in a warm draft-free place for 30 min. The dough should double in bulk.
Meanwhile, make the soaking liquid: Bring water to a boil, then mix in the baking soda. Pour into a shallow pie plate and let cool.

Cut the dough into 12 equal pieces and let rest for 10 min. Roll each piece into a long rope about 18" long. Twist to make a pretzel shape, and place ropes on a baking sheet. Taking 3 at a time, dip the pretzels into the water/soda mixture and then flip over, making sure both sides are covered. Place each dipped pretzel onto a baking sheet lined with parchment. Sprinkle pretzel salt on top of each. Let rest uncovered for 10 min.
Place pretzels in preheated oven for 8-10 min. or until lightly browned. Brush with melted butter while still hot.
Cook cut bacon in a large skillet over medium-high heat until crispy, and place on a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Set aside.
Cook pasta shells in boiling, salted water as directed on the pasta packaging. Pour pasta into a large colander and rinse under cold water until chilled and set aside.
Make the dressing by whisking together the mayonnaise, olive oil, lemon juice, mustard, salt and pepper until smooth and then stir in the parsley and chives.

Prepare the salad by placing the pasta shells in a large mixing bowl and adding the bacon, peas and red onion. Pour the dressing into the bowl and toss to combine until all the ingredients are well distributed and coated in the dressing.
Heat oven to 350°. Grease 9x13 pan.
Mix hash browns, cream of chicken soup, cheddar cheese, butter and salt and pepper together.
Add to 9x13 inch pan and bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown.
Preheat oven to 350°. Slice cooked potatoes into 9x13 pan.
Heat sour cream, soup, butter, and onions in a sauce pan; Pour over potatoes.
Cover with grated cheese.
Bake 30 min.
(Optional) Add 1-2 c. leftover ham (or a can of spam) to potato layers.
Before putting on heat, mix all ingredients except fruit (if there is not enough pinapple juice in the can, top off with juice from mandarin oranges).
Stir well (until all cornstarch is fully mixed in).
Put on heat. Stir until thick.
Serve over rice
Preheat oven to 350°
Combine cream cheese, butter, chicken, salt, pepper, onions, and pimientos.
Roll crescent rolls out. Put heaping tablespoon of mixture on each. Roll into crescent form and place on baking sheet.
Top each crescent with butter and crumbs.
Bake 20-25 min.
(Optional) Top with mushroom gravy.
Sauté mushrooms in butter; Stir in flour
Add liquid and stir until thickened
Preheat oven to 350°
Mix rice and soup and ½ onion soup in casserole dish.
Put 2-4 chicken breasts on top. Sprinkle rest of onion soup on top.
Bake for 1 ½-2 hours (depending on amount of chicken).
Preheat oven to 350°
Mix soup, sour cream, cheeses, onions, olives, and chilies. Set aside 2 cups.
Add chicken to remaining mixture.
Fill and roll tortillas; Place in 9x13 pan.
Pour reserved sauce over tortillas. Cover with cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350°
Combine tomato sauce and spaghetti mix and heat until boiling.
Combine all but noodles and sauce. Stuff uncooked manicotti and put in pan.
Pour sauce over noodles. Sprinkle with parmesan.
Cover with foil and bake for 45-50 minutes.

ingredients.name: K.C. Masterpiece barbecue sauce (or Bull's Eye barbecue sauce)

steps: Preheat oven to 275°-300°
Brown with no salt or pepper. Douse with Lawry's on top side. Put in baking pan.
Bake for 6-10 hours. Do not add any water or liquid.
When finished, shred and add barbecue sauce.
Serve on hamburger buns.

ingredients.name: chicken broth or water with bouillon (3 cubes)

steps: Combine and cook chicken broth, 5 c. water, potatoes, sugar, and broccoli.
Mix flour and ½ c. water and add to soup slowly
Add velveeta (more than 8 oz. can be used if desired) and allow cheese to melt.
Place all ingredients except milk, canned milk, butter, and flour in large 8 quart pot. Cook until potatoes are tender (about 20 min.).
Add canned milk combined with enough milk to measure a quart.
In a saucepan, melt butter. Add flour. Stir into soup until well blended.
Top soup with grated cheese when serving.
Cook chicken breasts with salt and water.
Remove chicken from water and shred. Add chicken bouillon cubes to water.
Add celery, carrots, potatoes, parsely flakes, and dried onion to broth. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Cook noodles seperate according to directions.
Add frozen peas, cooked noodles, and shredded chicken to broth.
Add garlic salt to taste
Combine butter and flour. Stir into soup until well blended.
Cook and drain beef. Season as instructed with taco seasoning.
Stir in soup, salsa, water, and tortillas. Heat to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and cook for 5 min. Stir.
Top with cheese.
(Optional) Stir in sour cream.
Brown meat; Drain.
Add barbecue sauce and ketchup. Cook until heated, stirring occasionally. Add more sauce if needed.
Serve on hamburger bun topped with cheese.

recipe_name: Ham and Cheddar in a Loaf
author: food & family - Fall 2004, p.18

steps: Preheat oven to 350°
Place dough on lightly floured surface; Flatten slightly with hands.
roll into 12x8 rectangle with rolling pin.
Top dough evenly with ham, overlapping slices slightly an dleaving a ½" border around all sides.
Mix cheese and Miracle Whip; Spread over ham
Moisten edges of dough with water. Starting at one of the long sides of dough, fold ⅓ of the dough over the filling, then repeat with the other side of dough.
Firmly pinch ends of dough together to seal. Place seam-side-down on lightly greased baking sheet.
Cut 3 diagonal slits on top; Brush with egg; Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
Bake 35-40 min. Cool 10 min. before cutting.

ingredients.name: beef bouillon cube
ingredients.notes: dissolved in ½ c. boiling water

steps: Mix meat, crackers, and half of the dressing until well blended. Shape into thirty-two 1" balls.
Cook meatballs in nonstick skillet on medium-high heat 8 min. or until browned, turning occasionally.
Add remaining dressing and bouillon; Simmer 5 min. or until meatballs are cooked through.
Stir in sour cream; Cook 30 sec. or until heated through, but not simmering, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve over curly noodles.
Preheat oven to 350°
Mix together all ingredients (except tortillas and enchilada sauce) and warm on stove.
Fill tortillas. Cover bottom of a 9x13 pan well with some of the enchilada sauce.
Add filled tortillas to pan; Cover with remaining enchilada sauce.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 min.
In small skillet, cook and stir eggs in oil until eggs are completely set. Remove and set aside.
In same skillet, cook rice, ham, garlic powder, ginger, and pepper until heated through.
Stir in soy sauce and reserved eggs. Serve immediately.
Preheat oven to 350°
Cook chicken in hot non-stick skillet 3-4 min. on each side or until browned. Place chicken in baking dish.
Mix dressing, jam, and soup mix in small bowl. Pour over chicken.
Bake 40 min. or until chicken is cooked. Serve with rice.
Preheat oven to 400°
Add hot water to stuffing mix; Stir until moistened. Set aside.
Place chicken in baking dish (middle size).
Mix juice, sugar, and butter until well blended; Pour over chicken.
Top with prepared stuffing. Bake 40 min. to 1 hour or until chicken is cooked through.
Preheat oven to 400°
Prepare stuffing as directed on packeage; Set aside.
Place chicken in 13x9 baking dish; Cover with ham.
Mix soup and mustard; Spoon over chicken. Top with stuffing.
Bake 25-40 min. or until chicken is cooked through.
Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 more min. or until cheese is melted.
Mix in bowl.
Preheat oven to 350°
Sauté butter, mushrooms, and onions.
Prepare dressing in microwave according to package.
Layer mushroom soup, turkey, dressing, and sauté mixture.
Bake for 25 min. covered.

recipe_name: Stephanie's Favorite Chicken in the Whole Wide World
author: Peggy Clark

subrecipes.name: Chicken
steps: Preheat oven to 400°
Thaw chicken, wipe dry. Mix all other ingredients and dredge chicken in mixture (easy in plastic or paper bag).
Melt butter in 9x13 baking dish. Place chicken in. Do not turn at this point.
Bake for 10-30 min.

subrecipes.name: Sauce
steps: Mix and heat to boiling point.
Turn chicken pieces and pour sauce over them.
Bake 35 min. or until well browned.
Salt and pepper meat. Brown meat and onions.
Add soup and milk.
Just before serving, fold in sour cream.
Serve over noodles.

ingredients.name: eggs
ingredients.notes: boiled and diced (or cut into coins)

steps: Combine all ingredients, adding paprika to taste.
Blend and serve.
Preheat oven to 350°
Cook meat. Drain fat off.
Add onion, soup, cheese, sugar, and seasoning. Simmer uncovered 15 min.
Cook noodles. Pour into baking dish and stir in sauce.
Mix corn flakes and butter. Sprinkle over top and bake for 25 min.
Melt butter and velveeta in a double boiler. Add drained crab and shrimp. Mix and serve warm.
Soak beans
Cook in crock pot. Salt and pepper to taste. Add 2 c. cooked rice.
Preheat oven to 350°
Place all ingredients into roaster. Cover with water. Bake for 2 hours.
Cook vegetables and meat separately. Mix and add other ingredients. Cook until warmed. Serve over rice.
Mix in small saucepan and bring to a light boil.
Bring sugar and water to a boil.
Add mapeline and vanilla.
Mix together all ingredients except butter.
Add butter. Cook into pancakes.
Add ingredients into bread machine in order.
Set bread machine for whole wheat, 2 lbs, light crust.
Mix yeast and 110° water. Add microwaved milk and water.
Add pepper, sugar, and salt and mix until dissolved
Add 4-5 c. flour; enough to be a little sticky. Knead.
Roll out, add toppings, and cook at 450° 10-15 minutes.
Preheat oven to 175°. When heated, turn off.
Combine 7 c. whole wheat flour, yeast, salt, flaxseed meal, and water in mixer. (Stir with spatula before mixing to avoid mess).
When dry ingredients are moistened with water, turn on mixer. Mix until well blended.
Add applesauce and honey. Continue to mix.
Add 5 c. more flour to mixture and let mix about 10 min. (dough should be sticky but not stick to you - cleans sides of bowl).
Spray counter with Pam (use oil for hands). Remove dough from mixer and form 4 loaves.
Place in oiled pan, oil top of loaves. Let rise ⅓ in bulk for approximately 35 min.
Bake at 350° for 40-45 min. Remove from pans to cool. Butter tops.
Preheat oven to 400°
Dissolve yeast in water in large bowl.
Stir in sugar, salt, and flour. Mix well.
Knead dough on floured surface for 7 min.
Divide the dough into 7 or 8 equal parts and roll each section into a snake and tie a loose knot to form pretzels.
Place pretzels on a greased cookie sheet and bake for 15-20 min. or until golden brown.
Brush melted butter on each baked pretzel and sprinkle with salt. YUM! YUM!
Preheat oven to 375°
Combine ingredients and put in a greased 11x13 pan.

subrecipes.name: Topping
steps: Combine and spread on mixture. Bake for 20-25 min.
